t: Hank Mobley - Workout [Vinyl] - Amazon.com Music
s: This is another excellent album by Hank Mobley which was his second sequel (after "Roll Call") to his highly praised "Soul Station" from 1960. This album finds him playing in the same lyrical style as on "Soul Station" with lots of rhythmic vitality and flowing melodies.

t: Amazon.com: Hank Mobley Quartet: CDs & Vinyl
s: Hank Mobley was one of the tenor sax greats hands down. I first learned of him when Charlie Haden mentioned how great he was in an interview I read. He played so beautifully over changes, and was so musical. No wasted notes. I especially love this recording, and, "Soul Station" because he and ...

t: Amazon.com: Hank Mobley - A Caddy For Daddy [LP]: CDs & Vinyl
s: Maybe not tier 1 Mobley, but tier 2 is still pretty good. Sounds fantastic, perfectly pressed. ... TRAVIS C. SCHULZ · Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021 ... This is essential Hank Mobley. Too many albums on the Blue Note label from the mid to late 60s, like this one, are forgotten.

t: HANK MOBLEY - the turnaround LP - Amazon.com Music
s: Hank Mobley's "The Turnaround" was originally issued on CD in the late 80s but was inexplicably deleted shortly thereafter. Thankfully it makes a permanent return to the Blue Note catalog in the RVG series, although in a slightly different format. On the initial CD versions of "No Room For Squares," "The Turnaround" and "Straight, No Filter" songs were rearranged to match their original recording sessions, instead of matching the original vinyl ...
